snippet: The device gives researchers a model for how to support and enhance fairly advanced mental skills in the frontal cortex of brain, the seat of thinking and planning.
abstract: Report in The Journal of Neural Engineering shows that scientists have designed a brain implant that sharpened decision making and restored lost mental capacity in monkeys, providing the first demonstration in primates of the sort of brain prosthesis that could eventually help people with damage from dementia, strokes or other brain injuries.
lead_paragraph: The device gives researchers a model for how to support and enhance fairly advanced mental skills in the frontal cortex of brain, the seat of thinking and planning.

headline.seo: Brain Implant Improves Thinking in Monkeys
headline.main: Brain Implant Improves Thinking in Monkeys, First Such Demonstration in Primates
